properties.publicTransport: Route 478 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek Festival will be taking place on Bay St on Sunday 16 Nov. Road closures and parking restrictions will be in effect.

Motorist are advised to allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov the following roads will be closed:

  • Bay St between Queens Rd and The Grand Pde
  • Bay St between Crawford St and Queens Rd (Eastbound lanes)
  • Moate Ave between Bay St and Saywell Ln

Motorists travelling on The Grand Parade will be detoured via local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 2am Sunday 16 Nov until 3am Monday 17 Nov on sections of Moate St and Bay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Bay Street between Crawford Street and Queens Road (Eastbound)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

From 2am Sunday 16 Nov to 3am Monday 17 Nov

  • Bay Street between Queens Street and The Grand Parade (Both sides)
  • Moate Avenue between Bay Street and Saywell Lane (Both sides)

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 370, 431 and 433 will be diverting around road closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney - Sydney Streets event on Glebe Point Rd. The event runs from 11am until 8pm.

The following roads will close from 7am to 11.30pm

  • Glebe Point Rd between St Johns Rd and Broadway, and adjoining roads including sections of Cowper St, Derwent Ln, Derby Pl, Francis St, Mitchell St and Norton St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity. Police may restrict vehicle access along closed roads, including residents and businesses.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 9:30pm on sections of Glebe Point Rd, Francis St, Derby Pl, Cowper St, Norton St and Mitchell St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Santa's Sydney Sleigh Ride in the Sydney CBD. Events start from 6.30pm and the Sleigh Ride will start at Customs House Square near Circular Quay at 8.10pm, travel along Pitt St and arrive at Martin Pl at approx. 8.20pm. The sleigh will then leave Martin Pl at 8.35pm, arriving at Town Hall at 8.45pm.

The following road closures will be in place from 5pm to 10.30pm to safely facilitate the event:

  • Pitt St between Hunter St and King St
  • Hunter St between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)

Managed access to Pitt St car parks will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King St to Martin Pl. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Place on Pitt Street.

Traffic in the CBD on approach to Pitt St will be heavy before, during and after the event. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Road Closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.

SYDNEY CBD - FROM 5PM TO 10.30PM

  • Hunter St* between Castlereagh St and Pitt St (westbound)
  • Pitt St^ between Hunter St and King St

*Local traffic access only (vehicles making deliveries or accessing Hunter St car parks).

^Managed access to Pitt St car parks (e.g. Angel Pl, Fullerton Hotel car park, Secure car park, Wilson car park, Telstra Broadcast Building car park) will be maintained via contra flow conditions from Hunter St to Martin Pl and from King Street to Martin Place. Vehicles cannot cross Martin Pl on Pitt St.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Sydney Kings at WIN Entertainment Centre on Sunday. Tip-off at 2.30pm, full time around 4.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Boiler Room at Sydney Showground on Saturday 15 November from 2pm until 11pm.

With a sold out crowd of 10,000 expected, and the Metallica concert with 70,000 fans expected at nearby Accor Stadium, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space, parking is in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time as traffic will be heavy while other events also take place in the precinct.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. Opal fares apply.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the match. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
WBBL matches at North Sydney Oval. Match days are Thursday 13 and 20 November, Sunday 30 November and Sunday 7 December.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around North Sydney Oval, especially during weekday peak travel times.

Allow extra time and travel with a group if you have to drive.

Limited street parking is available in the area and Ridge St car park is within walking Distance of the Oval. Fees apply.

arrangementElements.html:

Thursday 20 November at 3:40pm: WBBL: Melbourne Renegades v Hobart Hurricanes | Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Stars

Sunday 7 December at 10:40am: WBBL: Sydney Sixers v Adelaide Strikers

properties.otherAdvice:
Raydia Festival at The Domain on Saturday, from 3pm to 10pm.

With thousands of attendees expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the CBD as crowds travel to and from the event.

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.  

Roads within and around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event. Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and detours.

From 7pm to 11pm 

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road to Mrs Macquarie Road 

From 9pm to 11pm 

  • St Mary’s Rd from Prince Albert Rd to Sir John Young Cr 
  • Prince Albert Rd from College St to Art Gallery Rd 
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl

Club Broadway at The Domain on Sunday, from 1.30pm to 8.30pm.

With thousands of attendees expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the CBD as crowds travel to and from the event.

If you are catching rideshare or taxis, use the dedicated drop-off location on Hospital Road at Art Gallery Road. For pick-ups after the event head towards Elizabeth Street or Sir John Young Crescent.  

Roads within and around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event. Motorists should avoid driving through the area or expect delays and detours.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Australian National Busking Championship is coming to Cooma on Saturday 15 November, celebrating music and street performance.

The Snowy Mountains Hwy will be closed between Vale St and Bombala St.

Detours will be in place.

Motorists are advised to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.
properties.diversions: Detour via Bombala St, Commissioner St, Vale St and Massie St.

properties.publicTransport:
Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.

A free shuttle bus will be running from 8.30am to 3.40pm from Stockland Shellharbour to Shellharbour Airport.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 800 trucks and 900 motorbikes will form part of the annual Illawarra convoy travelling from Appin and Bulli Tops to finish near Shellharbour Airport in Albion Park Rail. Motorbikes will leave from West Cliff Colliery, Appin from 8:15am, trucks will leave from Maddens Plains at 8.30am.

The convoy will travel via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, M1 Princes Mwy, Masters Rd, Five Islands Rd, King St, Windang Rd, Shellharbour Rd, Lake Entrance Road, New Lake Entrance Rd and Princes Hwy. The convoy will finish at the Convoy shop, corner of Airport Rd and Princes Hwy, Albion Park Rail. Bikes will arrive from 9.15am and trucks from 10am.

Motorists may experience traffic delays along the convoy route. 

Speed reductions will be in effect at various times and locations between 4.30am and 3pm on sections of Appin Rd, M1 Princes Mwy and Princes Hwy.

The Old Princes Highway at Madden Plains will be closed between Helensburgh and Maddens Plains while trucks form up to participate in the convoy.

The right-hand turn from Old Mount Ousley Rd onto the M1 Princes Mwy/Mount Ousley Rd will be closed between 7am and 12pm. The convoy will travel in one lane along the route. 

Motorists are advised to take care as they share roads with the convoy vehicles and allow extra travel time in the area while changed traffic conditions are in place

roads.mainStreet: via Appin Road, Old Princes Highway, M1 Motorway,

webLinks.linkText: Stardew Valley Symphony of the Season

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stardew Valley Symphony of the Season Concert on Saturday 15 November at ICC Sydney Theatre. Show begins at 8pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the concert.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Multiple concerts at Qudos Bank Arena from Tuesday 18 until Saturday 22 November.

  • Tuesday 18 November – Lenny Kravitz: show starts at 7.30pm, finish around 11pm.
  • Thursday 20, Friday 21 and Saturday 22 November: RÜFÜS DU SOL: show starts at 7pm, finishing around 10.45pm nightly. 

Concurrent events in Olympic Park, attendees to RÜFÜS DU SOL concert are urged to leave the car at home and catch public transport to avoid significant traffic delays:

  • Friday 21 November – 70,000 AC/DC fans at Accor Stadium from 5pm.
  • Saturday 22 November – Tardezinha 10 years at Cathy Freeman Park from 2pm.

Traffic will be heavy approaching Olympic Park on concert nights, particularly during weeknight peak travel times and while other events are on in the precinct. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during the event. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Metallica concert at Accor Stadium on Saturday 15 November. Gates open from 5pm, concert finishes around 11pm.

With around 70,000 concert-goers expected, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

November concert nights on Fleet Steps at Mrs Macquaries Point in the Royal Botanic Garden.

  • Thursday 20 November: Olivia Dean. Starts at 7pm.
  • Friday 21 November: Hot Dub on the Harbour. Starts at 6pm, finishes around 10.30pm.
  • Saturday 22 November: Harbourlife. Starts at 2pm, finishes around 10pm.

ROAD CLOSURES – Thursday 20 to Saturday 22 November

  • From 12.30pm to midnight daily: Mrs Macquaries Road (northern loop)
  • From 8.30pm to 11pm daily: Art Gallery Rd from of Hospital Road and Mrs Macquaries Road

Allow extra time travelling in the area as traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees make their way to and from each show, particularly during the already busy weeknight peak.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off 7.35pm, full time around 9.20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the match.

A section of Mary Street may close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel St while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the area should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Melbourne United at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Buses run regularly to Rozelle. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info
properties.otherAdvice:
Soluna at White Bay Power Station on Saturday 15 November from 3pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching White Bay Power Station as large crowds travel to and from the event,

Attendees driving should carpool with their group, plan to arrive early to secure parking,

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Victoria Rd, the City West Link and Robert St.

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on transport. Buses will divert while roads are closed after the event. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Nitro Circus "Off The Rails" Tour at CommBank Stadium on Saturday. Show starts at 7.30pm and ends at 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Parramatta and nearby car parks are expected to be in high demand.

Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Drivers are reminded that light rail services are running through Parramatta CBD. Trams can’t stop quickly or easily – so exercise extra caution when driving in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Central Coast Mariners at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

properties.publicTransport: Concter tickets include travel on transport. Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sam Fender at The Entertainment Quarter. Show starts at 6.30pm, finish around 9.50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as thousands of attendees travel to the show is the already busy evening peak.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Albion St and Lang Road, and from 6am to 11pm on Cleveland St and Fitzroy St

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Cyclists will take part in the The Bondi2Berry 155km ride from Bondi Beach at 5.50am to Berry on the South Coast by 2:30pm.

Road closures will not be in place however motorists should exercise caution as they share roads with cyclists during the event.

The first group will leave Bondi at 5.50am travelling via Bondi Rd, Darley Rd, South Dowling St, General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Rocky Point Rd, Taren Point Rd, The Kingsway and the Princes Hwy through the Royal National Park to Stanwell Tops.

Cyclists will then continue along the coast via Otford Rd, Lawrence Hargrave Dr, Grand Pacific Dr, Princes Hwy, Memorial Dr and Squires Way into Wollongong. From there, cyclists will travel via Windang Rd and the Princes Hwy to Kiama before the last leg of the ride to Berry via Crooked River Rd, Beach Rd and Queen St.

Motorists may experience some delays along the cycle route particularly on Lawrence Hargrave Drive from Stanwell Park to Thirroul and the Princes Hwy at Bulli as they share roads with cyclists. Allow extra time and exercise caution. 

Drivers are reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: via General Holmes Dr, Grand Pde, Kingsway, Princes Hwy, Lawrence Hargrave Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Hay Mardi Gras Parade - Rainbow on the Plains festival is taking place along the Cobb Highway on Saturday.

Detours will be in place.
properties.diversions:
Motorists heading northbound will be detoured via along Brunker St, Pine St and Murray St.

Motorists heading southbound will be detoured via along Cadell St, Pine St and Brunker St.

webLinks.linkText: TfNSW Interactive road closure map - Vic100

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The inaugural Vic100 cycling event will travel 100km from Penrith to Mount Victoria via Bells Line of Road. Closures will be in place along parts of the course, while on other sections cyclists will share roads with motorists. The ride starts from Tench Reserve in Jamisontown, near Penrith, and finishes at the Victoria and Albert Guest House in Mount Victoria. 

Road closures:

Roads will be closed between 6.30am and 12pm along parts of the course including Bells Line of Road. Some roads around the start area in Penrith will close from 4.30am and roads around the finish area in Mount Victoria will remain closed til 4pm.

Bells Line of Rd closures:

  • Bells Line of Road will be closed to through traffic between Bell and Kurrajong from 6.30am to 12pm midday.
  • Bells Line of Rd will reopen between Kurrajong, Old Bells Line of Rd and Bilpin, Valley Ridges Rd at 10am but remain closed between Bell and Bilpin until 12pm midday.
  • Motorists travelling between Lithgow and Sydney on Sunday morning will need to use the Great Western Highway instead.
  • Cyclists will be travelling from Kurrajong to Bell in the westbound lane of Bells Line of Rd. Local traffic from properties along Bells Line of Rd needing to exit while the event is underway will be permitted to travel in the eastbound lane only, under direction of traffic control and under a reduced 40km/h speed limit.

Darling Causeway closures:

  • The Darling Causeway will be closed from Bell to Mount Victoria from 9.30am to 12.30pm. 
  • Motorists from Lithgow or Dargan can travel eastbound as far as Bell then will get turned around to return towards Lithgow. Motorists travelling between Mount Victoria and Lithgow can use the Great Western Hwy.

Local closures - Kurrajong, Jamisontown and Mount Victoria:

  • 4:30am to 8am sections of Jamison Rd and Tench Ave
  • 5:45am to 8:30am sections of Old Kurrajong Rd, Crowleys Ln and Yarramundi Ln
  • 6am to 9.30am Old Bells Line of Road northbound between Grose Vale Road and Bells Line of Road
  • Between 9.30am and 4pm sections of Station St until 1pm and Harley Ave until 4pm near Mount Victoria station

arrangementElements.html:

  • Tench Ave between the northern entry to Nepean Shores, The East Bank and Jamison Rd (Southbound)

SPEED ZONE REDUCTIONS

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Speed Zone Reductions

properties.diversions: Motorists travelling between Lithgow and Sydney on Sunday between 6.30am and 12pm will need to use the Great Western Highway instead while Bells Line of Rd is closed.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AC/DC concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 21 and Tuesday 25 November. Gates open from 5pm, concert finishes around 10.45pm each night.

With around 70,000 concert-goers expected at each show, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct. The roads will be particularly busy on Friday with 10,000 fans also attending a concert at Qudos Bank Arena next door.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.
